title: Sharply buffing literally everything in Kai'Sa's kit after one patch probably wasn't a good idea.

That way she doesn't just delete people late game through a play pattern of "If you don't die to four crits my fifth crit and execute will do the job" and make her early game easier to play because she won't be bullied out by so many champions. And then I watch as I can't hit the last proc because I'm just out of reach and would have to E into the enemy to do it.

Or....hit the W and apply 3 stacks since it does get evolved fairly early on in the game (2.1 items basically). Vayne also has less ways to actually get onto the target. Your ult more than makes up for the range difference between you and whomever meaning if someone else CC's them you can hit your W (that's 4 stacks), take your ult, use empowered Q, and then auto attack for the 5th stack and usually just kill them or at least do enough that they have to run away from you at which point you still have your E.

Kai'Sa was weak on release.
Due to her weird nature and builds, people struggled to find a balance sure but her laning right now still consists of having to level and evolve Q in order to deal damage and be able to clear waves. Her AA feels so weird to me because i don't feel like i do any damage unless i proc the 5th attack. But with low AS early, that's not an option on a champion you're forced to rush Q and isolate the target for maximum damage and who has a full utility ult. She really reminds me of Quinn, except she isn't as bad as her.

But still, you're forced to balance her engage on an edge case scenarios where you can cheese a passive proc from your allies or an isolated evolved Q damage, to then ult into them and go in for the kill. If you're comparing her to other Marksmen, sure.
But i'm not making that comparison and neither is Riot. They specifically made Kai'Sa with Vayne in mind but she clearly isn't Vayne 2.0 because he intentionally has constraints in her kit to prevent snowballing with tons of utility. And a 5-hit passive that's a pain to proc on low AS in the early game so you actually have to rely on your W and ally CC to do that.

Every other marksman has been made insanely powerful to such a high degree that Kai'Sa, a balanced champ on release, had to be buffed in order to for her to catch up to the powercreep of other marksman

Kai'Sa before ALL the buffs had a super powerful lategame with a really weak earlygame and had to rely on her support + other teammates in order to succeed before she got her first 3 items

Kai'Sa AFTER all the buffs now has a super powerful earlygame with an even more insane lategame and can succeed in a solo lane as well as the ADC role while outscaling any solo-laner that isn't an assassin or another ADC

Kai'Sa needed absolutely NO BUFFS

In fact, if Riot had used Kai'Sa as a wake-up call that other ADCs needed to be nerfed, we'd be looking at a way more balanced game over the next couple of patches

Instead of Riot nerfing the ADC powercreep, Riot has decided to continue making ADCs the most important part of any given team

> [{quoted}](name=MuffledGarbage,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=AbEZuXZ8,comment-id=00030001000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-30T18:11:58.517+0000)

So basically, she was the way ADC class is supposed to be. But when they actually behave that way as a whole, you have tears of whiny ADC mains flooding the boards. That's how we ended up with the idiotic "ADC2K17" situation and this horrible meta in the first place.

ADC2K17 was moreso because botlane had more value than any other lane(still does) and as such it was best tohave a 5-man dive party down there(or 4-man) due to the fact that Dragon was still giving global gold + the dragonslayer buffs

If a team DIDN'T bombard botlane then they were garunteed to lose against a team that DID bombard botlane

ADCs weren't getting the ability to play very often because the meta was becoming an earlygame meta

If Riot had just left the ADCs in the spot they were in, we would have had the opportunity to NATURALLY get Melee champs in the botlane

Instead Riot is forcing Melee champs to go botlane(see Irelia rework) and Riot is powercreeping those Melee champs in order to have them succeed. Riot's probably not going to be able to do this properly and end up with another Mordekaiser

Sadly, the balance team we have now only wants ADCs to be the center of a team and has officially stated that they want ADCs to be the star of every team, even if that means other teammates don't even matter in the long-run

"officially stated" where, exactly?
I don't mean "I heard this somewhere".

I mean "please provide an exact, indisputable link to this comment being made".

If it exists, great, because fuck Riot's champion favoritism.
If not, don't fearmonger.

In the patch notes, Riot has officially stated with their actions that they wish for ADCs to be the most powerful class

Just a couple patches ago, Kog got rebuffed after getting a SMALL nerf

Twitch got a nerf and then directly afterwards got a buff to the same move that was nerfed beforehand

Vayne hasn't been nerfed even slightly

None of the ADC's generic problem-items have been nerfed in their actual initial burst {{item:3087}} {{item:3094}}

Links or didn't happen, please.

Again, without sourcing it's just fearmongering. I'm not saying it's not the kind of dumb shit Riot would do, I'm just saying taking your interpretation of Riot's action as an "official statement" by Riot is a bad idea.

Actions that Riot takes are still an official statement. If that wasn't the case then someone could use that argument as follows:

_Hitler killed millions of Jewish people but taking that as an "official statement" that he WANTED to kill them is a bad idea_

Obviously we know that Hitler DID in fact want to kill millions of Jewish people(and did), but your argument of     
  "Actions =/= official statement"  isn't true because it can be proved otherwise.

Riot has consistently buffed ADCs who have dipped into lower winrates directly after those ADCs were nerfed

Riot has NOT consistently buffed any other class of champs whose winrates were lowered from nerfs directly after the nerf-in-question was issued

That fact alone shows that Riot wishes for ADCs to be the most powerful class

Riot hasn't made ADCs an optional class to take for a team, ever!!!

Riot has attempted to make champs to go into the botlane(See: Mordekaiser, New Irelia, Yasuo) but those attempts left the Solo-lane abilities of these champions FAR greater than what Riot expected which in turn made these champs initially overpowered before Riot nerfed them

ADCs on the otherhand have gone into Solo-lanes and hardly been nerfed down to the power level of other champions(See: Lucian, Corki, Quinn, Kai'Sa)

Remember when Lucian was nerfed to need more mana?

That's the time when Lucian moved into the midlane because he could lane-bully mages and assassins. The fact that a lategame-based champ is able to have such a strong earlygame means that at the time that Lucian moved to midlane, he was overpowered

Lucian afterwards was promptly nerfed because of how strong he was in the Solo-lane. Now Lucian-midlane plays similarly to a ranged assassin+ADC who scales up extremely well but hits a wall when lategame rolls around and         Lucian-Botlane is almost impossible to play without having an enchanter support alongside the enemy not picking one of the meta 3(Vayne,Trist, Twitch)

The whole situation with Lucian reveals that ADCs are the most powerful class in the game right now, and Riot has continued to make them stronger

So no official statement (which by the way, in your Hitler example a-la Godwin's Law would be literally all the documentation and discussion involving the "Final Solution").

I don't like Riot either, I just don't support witch-hunting.

Kai'Sa was made to take up a solo lane, jungle or bot.
She couldn't solo lane because she wasn't strong early and she couldn't even duo effectively if even a slightest bit of attention was thrown her way by the jungler or TP ganks bot. Then you're delaying her "core" to eventually 30 minutes, at which point she's too weak to even contest anything because she's then becoming "decent" while every other champion has outscaled her. And 3 items to get her core? Really? Half of inventory (not including boots) is what you call fine?

Just imagine any other mage, tank or a fighter in the same situation.
This isn't even true for their power spikes. They all spike earlier.

I think you took "ADC in 2k18 LUL" meme a little too literally.
The way people advocate for weaker Marksmen is what worries me. If you want to advocate that a Marksman cannot be a self-sufficient champion, then you're always going to tie them to a lane with a support. And you'll never have position diversity, even if Riot opens up bot lane for more picks than just ranged ADCs.

Kai'Sa worked on solo lanes on release. Kai'Sa's earlygame was just like Gangplank's. Farm and wait to scale up and then trash anyone who gets in your way once they HAVE scaled up

Kai'Sa didn't work in botlane because of her scaling like how ADCs used to scale

Before Riot made gold-value changes to ADC items(and other buffs), ADCs wouldn't be useful until around the 30-minute mark when they had 3-4 items

Delaying an ADCs "core" to 30 minutes is what ADCs are supposed to DO. Riot initially thought this and supported this

ADC2K17 was brought about because the elemental drakes weren't a thing, so it was just dragon. Dragon gave global gold(a lot of it) and gave buffs for every time you killed a dragon. This made 4-5 man diving parties at botlane popular because it was impossible to defend against as just an ADC+Support

After getting a free kill against an enemy ADC+Support, the dragon would also be free to take because enemy teams wouldn't have the manpower/damage to contest

If a team didn't use this strategy against a team that DID use this strategy, the team that didn't use this strategy would lose. **_GUARUNTEED_**


ADCs being almost useless until 30 minutes and 3-4 items in was a part of League's main draw to being an ADC. Sure you'd have to wait a while BUT then you become unstoppable afterwards(assuming team is grouped up and peeling properly)

As of right now, there is no phase in the game where an ADC is weak. ADCs get to deal as much damage as AND Melee champs' earlygame, more damage midgame with an RNG change to deal even MORE damage, and then lategame ADCs get to consistently run over any Melee champ that wanted to have fun

Melee champs have a slightly good earlygame, a great midgame, and generally a worse midgame than any ADC ever will have

I'll have you know that NOBODY is asking for Riot to make marksmen unplayable. NOBODY!!!

what people are asking for is for Marksmen to have an actual weak earlygame if their lategame is supposed to be where they shine(generically speaking)

Outliers like Lucian, Corki, Vayne, and now Kai'Sa are able to abuse most champs in the earlygame while proceeding to outscale most champs in the lategame. This leaves these few champs with 1 "weak" point in the entire game, and that's the midgame

The midgame is really just a point in the game where ADCs have a small chance to be shut down. A point in time that, if missed, will result in a loss for whichever side doesn't have the lead(assuming two teams are equally skilled)

There are Mages and Fighters that are in a similar position. Veigar won't ever have a really good early-midgame(even if he farmed Q perfectly) without an enemy messing up horridly and dying to him a lot. That would make it the fault of the enemy

Jax's early-midgame are famously exploitable for how easily he can be shut down at those times. Until the 30 minute mark when Jax has 3-4 items, he isn't very useful

Karthus's early-midgame is only good against melee champs, and even then he's extremely vulnerable to any jungle pressure and/or mobility. Until Karthus finishes 3-4 items, he isn't going to be doing much besides farming and waiting to scale

If you are willing to say that Kai'Sa deserves to scale as fast as other ADCs, then in order to be fair, you would also have to treat all other lategame-scaling champs the game and make their earlygames' as good as every ADCs while making their midgame a stalemate period and finally making their lategame a BEAST of nigh-unbeatable abilities + basic attacks

What annoys me the most is that there wasn't really any excuse for Riot to make this mistake, which is the same mistake they've made for practically every recent champion release. Scores of players were directly telling Rioters to be cautious, that players need time to learn her better, and to buff her conservatively with regards to how she evolves in the game's meta. The response? A perfunctory comment telling us that post-release balance changes are always done with extreme caution, that Riot wouldn't do anything of the sort if they didn't strongly believe that those buffs were warranted, and that balance changes go through a rigorous vetting process before they even hit the PBE. Fast forward to now, and Kai'Sa has a 52.8% win rate and a 20.8% play rate at Plat and above. She has been _way_ overbuffed, and so in a manner players have critiqued repeatedly before those buffs were even made known to us. We don't need more blanket post-release buffs, we need Riot to give new champions time to adjust so that their true potential can be properly assessed.

What's more is that Riot has also said that they'd be unwilling to revert these buffs, because whichever direction they'd take her following nerfs would somehow make her even healthier than immediately following her release. Riot needs to listen, and they need to change their balancing strategy with respect to new and overhauled champions. If they tell us again that they're implementing a post-release buff in absolute certainty, Kai'Sa will be but one of many examples that show that they've gone down that exact same path before, and are most likely to cause the same problems.
